articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Elon Musk's brain technology startup Neuralink said its implant, designed to allow paralyzed patients to use digital devices by thinking alone, is working well in a second trial patient.
articles.title: Musk's Neuralink says second trial implant went well, no thread retraction issue

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukraine launched a widespread drone attack on Russia on Wednesday, with air defence units destroying three drones some 38 kms (24 miles) south of the Kremlin, and 15 over the border Bryansk region, Russian officials said.
articles.title: Ukraine launches drone attack on Moscow, other regions, Russian officials say

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, James Mackenzie
articles.description: Israeli airstrikes across Gaza killed at least 50 Palestinians in the past 24 hours, Palestinian health authorities said on Wednesday, as the military said troops continued to target militants and seize weapons and ammunition.
articles.title: Israeli strikes kill dozens in Gaza after Blinken ends visit with truce deal still elusive

articles.author: Giselda Vagnoni
articles.description: The yacht was lying sideways at a depth of around 50 meters, giving divers up to 10 minutes to inspect it before having to resurface.
articles.title: Four bodies retrieved from Mike Lynch's sunken yacht in Sicily

articles.author: Andrea Shalal
articles.description: Minnesota Governor Tim Walz accepts the Democratic nomination for vice president on Wednesday with 11 weeks to go before he and presidential running mate Kamala Harris face Republican former President Donald Trump in the 2024 U.S. election.
articles.title: DNC on Wednesday: Minnesota's Walz, Pelosi, Bill Clinton

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: At least 24 people died after an overloaded boat capsized on a river in Congo's Mai-Ndombe province, and the death toll is expected to rise as many passengers are missing, a local official said on Wednesday.
articles.title: At least 24 killed as Congolese boat overturns

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The helicopter crash in which Iran's late President Ebrahim Raisi was killed in May was caused by weather conditions and the aircraft's inability to handle the weight it was carrying, Iran's semi-official news agency reported on Wednesday, citing a security source informed of the final investigation results.
articles.title: Helicopter of Iran's late President Raisi crashed due to weather, Fars says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Guatemalan prosecutors on Wednesday filed a request to strip President Bernardo Arevalo of the criminal immunity granted to his role so he can face charges for alleged abuse of authority, the latest twist in an ongoing face-off between the two sides.
articles.title: Guatemala prosecutors request to remove Arevalo's presidential immunity

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Senior officials from the U.S. State Department and the White House met on Wednesday with the Dalai Lama in New York and "reaffirmed the U.S. commitment to advancing the human rights of Tibetans," the State Department said.
articles.title: Senior US officials meet with Dalai Lama in New York

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said on Wednesday his forces understood what Moscow was attempting to do on the Pokrovsk front in eastern Ukraine, scene of Russian advances, and that Kyiv was strengthening its forces accordingly.
articles.title: Zelenskiy says Ukraine is boosting its forces in east to resist Russian advance
